ACT
75
Allocation in favor of descendants who did business with the testator
Irrespective of their inheritance rights, the decedent's descendant who lived with the decedent in community and contributed to the increase of his property with his work or donations, at the time of his death acquires the right to that part of the inheritance that corresponds to the value by which his contribution increased the property while lived in the community.
The part so separated does not belong to the estate and is not taken into account when calculating the necessary part, nor is it included in the heir's inheritance.
The right from paragraph 1 of this article is exercised only at the request of the authorized person. The right to submit a claim expires five years from the day the inheritance was opened.
